alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 17 at 2:56AM PST until February 17 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...Long period northwest swells will continue to impact the coast through Thursday... .A long period swell is impacting the coast. Initial forerunner periods will be from 19 to 22 seconds before slowly decreasing to around 16-19 seconds Thursday afternoon and evening. These high energy waves will increase the risk of sneaker waves and rip currents. ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Long period northwest swell expected. * WHERE...Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, San Francisco and Northern Monterey Bay. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Risk of sneaker waves and strong rip currents. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The threat will increase as the wind waves decrease through the day, especially in sheltered coves.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
